description: The different kinds of stained histological sections are widely used to detect and observe physiological and pathological changes in various tissues.
before_start: Bouin's fixative was formulated by saturated solution of picric acid (75 ml), 40% aqueous formaldehyde (25 ml), and glacial acetic acid (5 ml), kept at room temperature.
warning: Picric acid does not cause any direct allergies, but it would be converted into an allergenic chemical after contacting with tissue.

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Both white muscle and gonad tissues were taken from 250 tails per experimental group (AF/GF).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Both white muscle and gonad tissues were taken from 250 tails per experimental group (AF/GF).

components.data: White muscle samples were taken from each fish in GF and AF experimental groups, and temporarily stored in tissue fixative..
components.name: Description

source_data.description: White muscle samples were taken from each fish in GF and AF experimental groups, and temporarily stored in tissue fixative..

components.data: Storage of muscle samples used for H&E staining
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Storage of muscle samples used for H&E staining

components.data: 500 gonad samples were also collected from every experimental fish and kept in Bouin's fixative in 2 ml plastic tubes at 4 ℃.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 500 gonad samples were also collected from every experimental fish and kept in Bouin's fixative in 2 ml plastic tubes at 4 ℃.

components.data: Storage of gonad samples used for H&E staining
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Storage of gonad samples used for H&E staining

components.data: The back and abdominal muscle samples were immediately harvested and frozen in liquid nitrogen, then were transferred and preserved at -80 ℃ until Oil red O staining.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The back and abdominal muscle samples were immediately harvested and frozen in liquid nitrogen, then were transferred and preserved at -80 ℃ until Oil red O staining.

components.data: Storage of samples used for Oil red O staining
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Storage of samples used for Oil red O staining

components.data: Serial transverse 10 μm-thick sections of muscles and gonads were stained routinely with hematoxylin & eosin (H&E). To determine the presence of fat in the muscles, frozen muscle tissues were stained with Oil red O solution, which would color any fat contained in the muscle.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Serial transverse 10 μm-thick sections of muscles and gonads were stained routinely with hematoxylin & eosin (H&E). To determine the presence of fat in the muscles, frozen muscle tissues were stained with Oil red O solution, which would color any fat contained in the muscle.

components.data: The sex of each grass carp was determined by the contour of the gonad and further results of the gonad tissue slice (Jensen and Shelton, 1983; Ke, 1975).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The sex of each grass carp was determined by the contour of the gonad and further results of the gonad tissue slice (Jensen and Shelton, 1983; Ke, 1975).

components.data: The sex of the grass carp was determined by the contour of the gonad and further results of the gonad tissue slice. Based on the results of the sex determination, metabolomic analysis of muscle samples were divided into four test groups (n = 10): female fish of the grass feeding group (FGF), male fish of the grass feeding group (MGF), female fish of the artificial diet group (FAF), as well as male fish of the artificial diet group (MAF).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The sex of the grass carp was determined by the contour of the gonad and further results of the gonad tissue slice. Based on the results of the sex determination, metabolomic analysis of muscle samples were divided into four test groups (n = 10): female fish of the grass feeding group (FGF), male fish of the grass feeding group (MGF), female fish of the artificial diet group (FAF), as well as male fish of the artificial diet group (MAF).

components.data: A total of 200 - 400 fibers of per experimental group fish were studied using a Leica MZ 6 microscope for their cross sectional area. A size limit for identifying fibers was set at fiber diameters ≥ 10 μm as the optical resolution below this limit did not allow for sufficient identification and accuracy in the analyses.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: A total of 200 - 400 fibers of per experimental group fish were studied using a Leica MZ 6 microscope for their cross sectional area. A size limit for identifying fibers was set at fiber diameters ≥ 10 μm as the optical resolution below this limit did not allow for sufficient identification and accuracy in the analyses.
